item.title: Jo add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Jo add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jo add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A proud man is always looking down on things and people; and, of course, as long as you are looking down, you cannot see something that is above you." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jo add a quote by Henry James
Jo add a quote by Clive James
item.description: "Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing." -- Clive James

item.title: Jo add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Her reputation for reading a great deal hung about her like the cloudy envelope of a goddess in an epic." -- Henry James

item.title: Jo add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jo add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jo add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jo add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jo add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jo add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The great tragedy of life is not that men perish, but that they cease to love." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jo add a quote by Matthew J. Kirby
item.description: "In life, the hardest decisions often have to be made more than once. But each time, it gets easier." -- Matthew J. Kirby

item.title: Jo add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jo add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jo add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard
